titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the American Institutes for Research reports
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-18T08:46-0700

change.item: Finding aid cleaned up by Theresa Berger.
Edited to add offsite storage note and updated code to OAC best practices.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::American Institutes for Research Reports)//EN" "" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: American Institutes for Research reports
did.abstract: Relates to development and evaluation of educational programs and methodologies, career guidance and training programs, and study of human behavior in various specific aspects.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is stored off-site. It may be possible to have a limited number of boxes brought to the archives reading room for examination. A minimum of two days notice is required. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], American Institutes for Research reports, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1991.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: American non-profit institution for educational and social science research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Relates to development and evaluation of educational programs and methodologies, career guidance and training programs, and study of human behavior in various specific aspects.

did.unittitle: General Topics File

odd.head: General note
odd.p: There are no Project PLAN (670) reports in storage.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Although the contents of this box represent the major publications from Project TALENT, it is not a comprehensive collection. Other TALENT publications not included here can be borrowed via inter-library loan from American Institutes for Research, Palo Alto.
